intro: Dortmanna mishmica, commonly known as the Himalayan snow buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its delicate, yellow flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. It is a perennial herb that produces small, fleshy roots and is adapted to withstand harsh mountain climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
